intro: Diplotaxis antoniensis, commonly known as the Antoni's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, pale green leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
